result.execSummary:
The defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Credit for 4 days time served.  The first 21 days will be served is custody without release privileges. After this initial period of incarceration, if you have no major rule violations, and are accepted in the the Day Reporting Program, you may serve the balance of your sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program.  The Court will have no objection to the Defendant being placed on Electronic Monitoring while participating in the program. Should the defendant any condition of electronic monitoring or the rules at the Day Reporting Program the defendant will serve the balance of the sentence without release privileges.

No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.MUST provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab, if you have not previously done so. DNA sample 973.046 & 973.047.  Defendant cannot vote in any election until your civil rights are restored. 973.176(2).
Pay costs, surcharges, assessment, supervision and DNA fees due on or before 7-1-15. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period imprisonment or $25,00 fine or both.  Possess Weapons a a Convicted Felon - 973.176(1).
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  AODA assessment and treatment.  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donovan Montreal Sanders

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 4 days time served.  The first 21 days will be served is custody without release privileges. After this initial period of incarceration, if you have no major rule violations, and are accepted in the the Day Reporting Program, you may serve the balance of your sentence with release privileges to attend the Day Reporting Program.  The Court will have no objection to the Defendant being placed on Electronic Monitoring while participating in the program. Should the defendant any condition of electronic monitoring or the rules at the Day Reporting Program the defendant will serve the balance of the sentence without release privileges.
  
COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CODITIONS:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessment, supervision and DNA fees due on or before July 1st, 2015. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment and treatment.
*  Random urine screens. No association with drug users, drug dealers, drug houses, or drug dealing.
*  MUST provide a DNA sample to the State Crime Lab, if you have not previously done so. DNA sample 973.046 & 973.047
*  AS a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms at any time in the future - 941.29 Wis. Stats. makes it another felony for anyone who has been convicted of a felony to ever possess a firearm, carrying with it its own 10 year period imprisonment or $25,00 fine or both.  Possess Weapons a a Convicted Felon - 973.176(1).
*  Defendant cannot vote in any election until your civil rights are restored. 973.176(2).

Received and filed with court:
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.   There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons.  Patricia I Daugherty for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with Cheslea Brocker, student, with attorney Melissa J Fitzsimmons.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress proceeds.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Christopher Conway.  State rests. Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds the officer appropriately searched the defendant and subsequent to the arrest did appropriately search the vehicle.  Court denies the defense motion.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
State's Response to defendant's Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds
Motion to Suppress received and filed./ds

Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  William Levins for Nathaniel Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Motions to be filed by 4-2-14; response/reply by 4-16-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense needs to review discovery for possible motions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with attorney Melissa J. Fitzsimmons.  Paul Hauer for Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/28/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in court with attorney Melissa Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Donovan Montreal Sanders in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
